content:
It should be specified that the arrow does not follow the shortest path to Gobball but rather takes a 90 degree turn mid-flight to follow MANHATTAN DISTANCE. Or, perhaps preferably, change the problem and proposed solution to use the more logical Euclidian distance.

Also currently if you do the logical thing and expect arrows to fly straight you will fail a test case but pass the validators which indicates your test cases and validators are not equivalent.

you should specify :
- Evangelyne can shoot an arrow at Gobball as long as she is within its range (Manhattan distance).
because some people can think of the Euclidian distance first (this can be misleading and should be avoided).
You should mention that she can shoot only vertically and horizontally.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Fun; I really enjoyed solving this little puzzle.

❌ Rejected the contribution.
Comment: Bad distance calculation !
(see my comment below)

It should be noticed in the statement that the range uses manhattan distance and not the euclidian distance. Also the statement needs to be changed as: she can only move vertically OR horizontally. Otherwise, this problem could not be solved except by doing irrelevent asumptions.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Little board game explained with a fun and clear statement

❌ Rejected the contribution.
Comment: The arrow should follow a straight line, hence the condition for a valid shoot at Goball should be `Math.sqrt((x1-x2)**2 + (y1-y2)**2) <= rng)`. I disagree with the given solution.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Fun little problem. I enjoyed solving it.

Game is good and clear except for  Evangelyne's  characteristics. 
range and speed are also called rng and mp
might be best to always call them range and speed
Great!!

You should also replace "rng" and "mp" by "range" and "speed" in the description(see below)  and in the code for clarity's sake ("rng" is particularly not intuitive)

"rng is the distance of Evangelyne can shoot an arrow."
"mp is the distance of Evangelyne can move in one turn."

Nice game !
I hope you received enough feedback from the community to improve your contribution. Once you have made the necessary updates, publish your contribution!
I would prefer if rng and mp were changed to something more understandable, like range and speed.
Top !

I would probably specify more clearly if additional round is required to shoot at Gobball and should be counted in solution.
For example something like:
After reaching shoot range Evangelyne needs one more round to shoot. - (or not if she doesn't).

Good exercise!

Do I understand right the rule "she will move mp per turn and no less"? It looks like Evangelyne will always bypass Gobball and never get close enough if the input is e.g. "5, 5, 2, 2, 1, 6". Both x and y will be either "2" or "8" as closest to "5".

Your proposed solution doesn't even use the real point to point distance formula and you check for `turn < 2`.
`d=√((x₂ - x₁)² + (y₂ - y₁)²)`
Only validator 2 fails with the real formula which is a huge problem. 
`Ev: [2, 14]`
`Gb: [8, 17]`
`Distance: 6.708203932499369`
`Range: 6`

In the Output section, you say "If the number of turns is less than 1 then FIGHT NOW". 
However, in your solution, you used "turns < 2" in your code to write that condition. You should clarify in the description with "If the number of turns is equal or less than 1 then FIGHT NOW".

Nice exercise, by the way !

Goal section
* Too little explanation.
* Please be consistent with the other sections: either "the gobball" or "Gobball".

Input section
* "carateristics" should be spelled as "characteristics".
* I don't see any necessity of N as an input.

Stub generator
* The provision/reading of inputs using loops is usually for the same kind of inputs, which is not the case in your clash.
* Why the awkward input of comma-separated values? Using space-separated integers is the usual practice here.

Output section
* "round up" is not a constant. Please just format it as bold if needed.
Thanks for the feedback I will correct the mistakes !
done ;)

Goal section: please fix "withinits" as "within its".

Please specify how movement is made. It looks like Evangelyne can go diagonally at any angle to any non-integer coordinates right now. It is fine, but must be clearly specified. (Otherwise one may assume that movement is always horizontal or vertical and restricted to integer coordinates.)

Not sure if the player may also assume that rounding up is required DURING movements...

The stub generator is not ideal as the variable names do not match the input section. And better just parse the integers instead of providing strings.
So my suggestion is:
read x1:int y1:int
read x2:int y2:int
read rng:int mp:int
range is changed to rng because it is a keyword in some programming languages.

If you adopt my suggestion then corresponding amendments are required in Goal section and Input section.
I have edited the statement so that it matches the stub generator and the solution code.
